blocks.name: qtopbaslem
blocks.content: The set of open intervals with endpoints in a subset forms a basis for a topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jun-2014.)

blocks.name: qtopbas
blocks.content: The set of open intervals with rational endpoints forms a basis for a topology. (Contributed by NM, 8-Mar-2007.)

blocks.name: retopbas
blocks.content: A basis for the standard topology on the reals. (Contributed by NM, 6-Feb-2007.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jun-2014.)

blocks.name: retop
blocks.content: The standard topology on the reals. (Contributed by FL, 4-Jun-2007.)

blocks.name: uniretop
blocks.content: The underlying set of the standard topology on the reals is the reals. (Contributed by FL, 4-Jun-2007.)

blocks.name: retopon
blocks.content: The standard topology on the reals is a topology on the reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: retps
blocks.content: The standard topological space on the reals. (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-2012.)

blocks.name: iooretop
blocks.content: Open intervals are open sets of the standard topology on the reals . (Contributed by FL, 18-Jun-2007.)

blocks.name: icccld
blocks.content: Closed intervals are closed sets of the standard topology on ` RR ` . (Contributed by FL, 14-Sep-2007.)

thm icccld(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(co(c0, cicc, c1), cfv(ccld, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))))
} = {
  mpbird(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wcel(co(c0, cicc, c1), cfv(ccld, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))), wcel(cdif(cr, co(c0, cicc, c1)), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))))
  syl6eqel(cdif(cr, co(c0, cicc, c1)), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), cun(co(cmnf, cioo, c0), co(c1, cioo, cpnf)), wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)))
  difreicc(c0, c1)
  mp3an(wcel(cun(co(cmnf, cioo, c0), co(c1, cioo, cpnf)), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))), wcel(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), ctop), wcel(co(cmnf, cioo, c0), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))), wcel(co(c1, cioo, cpnf), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))))
  iooretop(cmnf, c0)
  iooretop(c1, cpnf)
  unopn(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), co(cmnf, cioo, c0), co(c1, cioo, cpnf))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cr), wcel(c1, cr)), wb(wcel(co(c0, cicc, c1), cfv(ccld, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))), wcel(cdif(cr, co(c0, cicc, c1)), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))), wcel(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), ctop), wss(co(c0, cicc, c1), cr))
  retop()
  iccssre(c0, c1)
  iscld2(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), co(c0, cicc, c1), cr)
  uniretop()
}

thm icccld(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ)→(c0[[,]]c1)∈(Clsd `(topGen ` ran((,)))))
} = {
  mpbird((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ), (c0[[,]]c1)∈(Clsd `(topGen ` ran((,)))), (ℝ \(c0[[,]]c1))∈(topGen ` ran((,))))
  syl6eqel((ℝ \(c0[[,]]c1)), (topGen ` ran((,))), ((-∞[(,)]c0)⋃(c1[(,)]+∞)), (c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ))
  difreicc(c0, c1)
  mp3an(((-∞[(,)]c0)⋃(c1[(,)]+∞))∈(topGen ` ran((,))), (topGen ` ran((,)))∈ Top, (-∞[(,)]c0)∈(topGen ` ran((,))), (c1[(,)]+∞)∈(topGen ` ran((,))))
  iooretop(cmnf, c0)

blocks.content: Value of the distance function of the metric space of complex numbers. (Contributed by NM, 9-Dec-2006.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Dec-2014.)

thm cnmetdval(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(c0, c2, c1), cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1))))
  -| wceq(c2, ccom(cabs, cmin))
} = {
  3eqtr4g(co(c0, c2, c1), cfv(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1)), cfv(ccom(cabs, cmin), cop(c0, c1)), cfv(cabs, cfv(cmin, cop(c0, c1))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)))
  sylancr(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(cfv(ccom(cabs, cmin), cop(c0, c1)), cfv(cabs, cfv(cmin, cop(c0, c1)))), wf(cmin, cxp(cc, cc), cc), wcel(cop(c0, c1), cxp(cc, cc)))
  subf()
  opelxpi(c0, cc, c1, cc)
  fvco3(cmin, cxp(cc, cc), cc, cop(c0, c1), cabs)
  eqtri(co(c0, c2, c1), cfv(ccom(cabs, cmin), cop(c0, c1)), cfv(c2, cop(c0, c1)))
  df-ov(c0, c2, c1)
  fveq1i(c2, cop(c0, c1), ccom(cabs, cmin))
  fveq2i(cabs, co(c0, cmin, c1), cfv(cmin, cop(c0, c1)))
  df-ov(c0, cmin, c1)
}

blocks.name: cnmet
blocks.content: The absolute value metric determines a metric space on the complex numbers. This theorem provides a link between complex numbers and metrics spaces, making metric space theorems available for use with complex numbers. (Contributed by FL, 9-Oct-2006.)

blocks.name: blssioo
blocks.content: The balls of the standard real metric space are included in the open real intervals. (Contributed by NM, 8-May-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Nov-2013.)

thm blssioo(class c0) {
  |- wss(crn(cfv(cbl, c0)), crn(cioo))

  elxr(cv(hs2))

  eqeltrd(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c0), cv(hs2)), crn(cioo), co(co(cv(hs1), cmin, cv(hs2)), cioo, co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs2))), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wcel(cv(hs2), cr)))

  syl6eqel(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c0), cv(hs2)), crn(cioo), cr, wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wceq(cv(hs2), cpnf)))
  sylan9eqr(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c0), cv(hs2)), cr, co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c0), cpnf), wcel(cv(hs1), cr), wceq(cv(hs2), cpnf))
  oveq2(cv(hs2), cpnf, cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c0))

blocks.name: tgioo

  syl22anc(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), crn(cioo)), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))), wrex(hs3, crn(cioo), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs3)), wss(cv(hs3), cin(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c1), nat1))))), wcel(crn(cioo), ctb), wcel(cv(hs0), crn(cioo)), wcel(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c1), nat1), crn(cioo)), wcel(cv(hs1), cin(cv(hs0), co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, c1), nat1))))

blocks.name: rehaus
blocks.content: The standard topology on the reals is Hausdorff. (Contributed by NM, 8-Mar-2007.)

blocks.name: tgqioo
blocks.content: The topology generated by open intervals of reals with rational endpoints is the same as the open sets of the standard metric space on the reals. In particular, this proves that the standard topology on the reals is second-countable. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-Jun-2014.)
blocks.origin:

thm resubmet(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, cr), wceq(c1, co(c2, crest, c0)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))

} = {
  eqtr4d(c1, co(c2, crest, c0), cfv(cmopn, cres(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cxp(c0, c0))), wss(c0, cr))
  syl6reqr(c1, cfv(cmopn, cres(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cxp(c0, c0))), cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0))), wss(c0, cr))
  fveq2d(cmopn, cres(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cxp(c0, c0)), cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(c0, c0)), wss(c0, cr))
  resabs1d(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr), cxp(c0, c0), wss(c0, cr))
  anidms(wss(c0, cr), wss(cxp(c0, c0), cxp(cr, cr)))
  xpss12(c0, cr, c0, cr)
  mpan(wss(c0, cr), wceq(co(c2, crest, c0), cfv(cmopn, cres(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cxp(c0, c0)))), wcel(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cfv(cxmet, cr)))
  rexmet(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)))
  metrest(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cr, c0, c2, cfv(cmopn, cres(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cxp(c0, c0))), cres(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cxp(c0, c0)))
  eqid(cres(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)), cxp(c0, c0)))
  eqtri(c2, cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr))), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  tgioo(cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr))), cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)))
  eqid(cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)))
  eqid(cfv(cmopn, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr))))

}

blocks.name: xrrest
blocks.content: The subspace topology induced by a subset of the reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm xrrest(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, cr), wceq(co(c1, crest, c0), co(c2, crest, c0)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cordt, cle))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
} = {
  syl5req(co(c1, crest, c0), co(c2, crest, c0), co(co(c1, crest, cr), crest, c0), wss(c0, cr))
  oveq1i(c2, crest, c0, co(c1, crest, cr))
  eqtri(c2, co(c1, crest, cr), cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  xrtgioo(co(c1, crest, cr))
  oveq1i(c1, crest, cr, cfv(cordt, cle))
  mp3an13(wss(c0, cr), wceq(co(co(c1, crest, cr), crest, c0), co(c1, crest, c0)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cr, universe))
  fvexi(c1, cordt, cle)
  reex()
  restabs(c1, universe, c0, cr, universe)
}

thm xrrest(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ⊆ ℝ →(c1[|`t]c0)=(c2[|`t]c0))
  ⊣ c1 =(ordTop ` ≤)
  ⊣ c2 =(topGen ` ran((,)))
} = {
  syl5req((c1[|`t]c0), (c2[|`t]c0), ((c1[|`t]ℝ)[|`t]c0), c0 ⊆ ℝ)
  oveq1i(c2, crest, c0, (c1[|`t]ℝ))
  eqtri(c2, (c1[|`t]ℝ), (topGen ` ran((,))))
  xrtgioo((c1[|`t]ℝ))
  oveq1i(c1, crest, cr, (ordTop ` ≤))
  mp3an13(c0 ⊆ ℝ, ((c1[|`t]ℝ)[|`t]c0)=(c1[|`t]c0), c1 ∈ 𝕌, ℝ ∈ 𝕌)
  fvexi(c1, cordt, cle)
  reex()
  restabs(c1, universe, c0, cr, universe)
}

blocks.name: xrsdsre
blocks.content: The metric on the extended reals coincides with the usual metric on the reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: xrsblre
blocks.content: Any ball of the metric of the extended reals centered on an element of ` RR ` is entirely contained in ` RR ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.)

  eqeltrrd(hs0, cr, c0, (((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ*)∧(c0 ∈ ℝ* ∧ hs0 ∈ ℝ* ∧(c0[c2]hs0)∈ ℝ))∧ c0 = hs0))
  simpr(((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ*)∧(c0 ∈ ℝ* ∧ hs0 ∈ ℝ* ∧(c0[c2]hs0)∈ ℝ)), c0 = hs0)
  simplll(c0 ∈ ℝ, c1 ∈ ℝ*, (c0 ∈ ℝ* ∧ hs0 ∈ ℝ* ∧(c0[c2]hs0)∈ ℝ), c0 = hs0)
  simprd((((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ*)∧(c0 ∈ ℝ* ∧ hs0 ∈ ℝ* ∧(c0[c2]hs0)∈ ℝ))∧ c0 ≠ hs0), hs0 ∈ ℝ, c0 ∈ ℝ)

  simplr3((c0 ∈ ℝ ∧ c1 ∈ ℝ*), c0 ∈ ℝ*, hs0 ∈ ℝ*, (c0[c2]hs0)∈ ℝ, c0 ≠ hs0)

blocks.name: xrsmopn
blocks.content: The metric on the extended reals generates a topology, but this does not match the order topology on ` RR* ` ; for example ` { +oo } ` is open in the metric topology, but not the order topology. However, the metric topology is finer than the order topology, meaning that all open intervals are open in the metric topology. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  ⊢ ℤ ∈(Clsd ` c0)
  ⊣ c0 =(topGen ` ran((,)))

  eliun(hs0, hs1, cz, (hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1)))
  impbii(∃(hs0 ∈ ℤ, hs1 ∈(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1))), hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ))
  rexlimiva(hs0, cz, hs1 ∈(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1)), hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ))
  eldifd(hs1, cr, cz, (hs0 ∈ ℤ ∧ hs1 ∈(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1))))
  adantl(hs0 ∈ ℤ, hs1 ∈(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1)), hs1 ∈ ℝ)
  elioore(hs1, hs0, (hs0[+]1))
  sylan2(hs0 ∈ ℤ, hs1 ∈(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1)), ¬ hs1 ∈ ℤ, (hs0[<]hs1 ∧ hs1[<](hs0[+]1)))
  eliooord(hs1, hs0, (hs0[+]1))
  3expb(hs0 ∈ ℤ, hs0[<]hs1, hs1[<](hs0[+]1), ¬ hs1 ∈ ℤ)
  btwnnz(hs0, hs1)
  syl2anc(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ), ∃(hs0 ∈ ℤ, hs1 ∈(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1))), (⌊ ` hs1)∈ ℤ, hs1 ∈((⌊ ` hs1)[(,)]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1)))
  mpbir3and(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ), hs1 ∈((⌊ ` hs1)[(,)]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1)), hs1 ∈ ℝ, (⌊ ` hs1)[<]hs1, hs1[<]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1))

  syl(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ), (⌊ ` hs1)[≤]hs1, hs1 ∈ ℝ)

  syl2anc(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ), (⌊ ` hs1)≠ hs1, (⌊ ` hs1)∈ ℤ, ¬ hs1 ∈ ℤ)
  eldifn(hs1, cr, cz)
  nelne2((⌊ ` hs1), cz, hs1)
  syl(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ), hs1[<]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1), hs1 ∈ ℝ)
  flltp1(hs1)
  syl2anc(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ), (hs1 ∈((⌊ ` hs1)[(,)]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1))↔(hs1 ∈ ℝ ∧(⌊ ` hs1)[<]hs1 ∧ hs1[<]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1))), (⌊ ` hs1)∈ ℝ*, ((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1)∈ ℝ*)
  rexrd((⌊ ` hs1), hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ))
  rexrd(((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1), hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ))
  syl(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ), ((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1)∈ ℝ, (⌊ ` hs1)∈ ℝ)
  zred((⌊ ` hs1), hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ))

  eldifi(hs1, cr, cz)
  peano2re((⌊ ` hs1))
  elioo2((⌊ ` hs1), ((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1), hs1)
  rspcev(hs0, (⌊ ` hs1), cz, hs1 ∈((⌊ ` hs1)[(,)]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1)), hs1 ∈(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1)))
  eleq2d(hs1, (hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1)), ((⌊ ` hs1)[(,)]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1)), hs0 =(⌊ ` hs1))
  oveq12d(hs0, cioo, (hs0[+]1), (⌊ ` hs1), ((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1), hs0 =(⌊ ` hs1))

  mp2an((ℤ ∈(Clsd ` c0)↔(ℝ \ ℤ)∈ c0), c0 ∈ Top, ℤ ⊆ ℝ)
  eqeltri(c0, ctop, (topGen ` ran((,))))
  retop()
  zssre()
  iscld2(c0, cz, cr)
  eqtr4i(cr, ⋃ c0, ⋃(topGen ` ran((,))))
  uniretop()
  unieqi(c0, (topGen ` ran((,))))
  diff.hs1.c(⋃(hs0 ∈ ℤ,(hs0[(,)](hs0[+]1))))
  diff.hs1.c((ℝ \ ℤ))
  diff.hs0.c(hs1)
  diff.hs0.w(hs1 ∈(ℝ \ ℤ))
  diff.hs0.c((⌊ ` hs1))
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.w(hs1 ∈((⌊ ` hs1)[(,)]((⌊ ` hs1)[+]1)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

  ⊣ c0 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)
} = {
  mpbir(ℝ ∈(Clsd ` c0), (ℂ \ ℝ)∈ c0)
  mpbir2an((ℂ \ ℝ)∈ c0, (ℂ \ ℝ)⊆ ℂ, ∀(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), ∃(hs1 ∈ ℝ+,(hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))]hs1)⊆(ℂ \ ℝ))))
  difss(cc, cr)
  rgen(hs0, (ℂ \ ℝ), ∃(hs1 ∈ ℝ+,(hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))]hs1)⊆(ℂ \ ℝ)))
  syl2anc(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), ∃(hs1 ∈ ℝ+,(hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))]hs1)⊆(ℂ \ ℝ)), (abs `(Im ` hs0))∈ ℝ+, (hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0)))⊆(ℂ \ ℝ))
  absrpcld((Im ` hs0), hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ))
  mpbid(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), (Im ` hs0)≠ 0, ¬ hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  eldifn(hs0, cc, cr)
  necon3bbid((Im ` hs0), nat0, hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs0 ∈ ℝ)
  syl(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), (hs0 ∈ ℝ ↔(Im ` hs0)= 0), hs0 ∈ ℂ)
  reim0b(hs0)
  ssrdv(hs1, (hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0))), (ℂ \ ℝ), hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ))
  sylbid(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈(hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0))), hs1 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), (hs1 ∈ ℂ ∧(hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0))))
  mp3an2i(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), (hs1 ∈(hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0)))↔(hs1 ∈ ℂ ∧(hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0)))), (abs ∘ -)∈(*Met ` ℂ), hs0 ∈ ℂ, (abs `(Im ` hs0))∈ ℝ*)
  rexrd((abs `(Im ` hs0)), hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ))
  abscld((Im ` hs0), hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ))
  elbl((abs ∘ -), cc, hs0, (abs `(Im ` hs0)), hs1)
  ex(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), (hs1 ∈ ℂ ∧(hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0))), hs1 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ))
  eldifd(hs1, cc, cr, (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧(hs1 ∈ ℂ ∧(hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0)))))
  simprl(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈ ℂ, (hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0)))
  impr(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈ ℂ, (hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0)), ¬ hs1 ∈ ℝ)
  adantr(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈ ℂ, ((hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0))→ ¬ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  con2d(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), (hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0)), hs1 ∈ ℝ)
  ex(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈ ℝ, ¬(hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)[<](abs `(Im ` hs0)))
  eqnbrtrd((hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1), clt, (abs `(Im ` hs0)), (abs `(hs0[-]hs1)), (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  syl2anc((hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ), (hs0[(abs ∘ -)]hs1)=(abs `(hs0[-]hs1)), hs0 ∈ ℂ, hs1 ∈ ℂ)
  cnmetdval(hs0, hs1, (abs ∘ -))
  eqid((abs ∘ -))
  lensymd((abs `(hs0[-]hs1)), (abs `(Im ` hs0)), (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  abscld((Im ` hs0), (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  abscld((hs0[-]hs1), (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  eqbrtrrd((abs `(Im ` hs0)), cle, (abs `(hs0[-]hs1)), (abs `(Im `(hs0[-]hs1))), (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))

  adantr(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈ ℝ, (Im ` hs0)∈ ℂ)
  recnd((Im ` hs0), hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ))

  syl((hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ), (abs `(Im `(hs0[-]hs1)))[≤](abs `(hs0[-]hs1)), (hs0[-]hs1)∈ ℂ)
  subcld(hs0, hs1, (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  adantr(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈ ℝ, hs0 ∈ ℂ)
  eldifi(hs0, cc, cr)
  recnd(hs1, (hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ)∧ hs1 ∈ ℝ))
  simpr(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), hs1 ∈ ℝ)
  absimle((hs0[-]hs1))
  rspcev(hs1, (abs `(Im ` hs0)), crp, (hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0)))⊆(ℂ \ ℝ), (hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))]hs1)⊆(ℂ \ ℝ))
  sseq1d((hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))]hs1), (ℂ \ ℝ), (hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0))), hs1 =(abs `(Im ` hs0)))
  oveq2(hs1, (abs `(Im ` hs0)), hs0, (ball `(abs ∘ -)))
  ax-mp(((ℂ \ ℝ)∈ c0 ↔((ℂ \ ℝ)⊆ ℂ ∧ ∀(hs0 ∈(ℂ \ ℝ), ∃(hs1 ∈ ℝ+,(hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))]hs1)⊆(ℂ \ ℝ))))), (abs ∘ -)∈(*Met ` ℂ))
  elmopn2(hs0, hs1, (abs ∘ -), cc, (ℂ \ ℝ), c0)
  mp2an((ℝ ∈(Clsd ` c0)↔(ℂ \ ℝ)∈ c0), c0 ∈ Top, ℝ ⊆ ℂ)
  cnfldtop(c0)
  ax-resscn()
  iscld2(c0, cr, cc)
  ax-mp(ℂ = ⋃ c0, (abs ∘ -)∈(*Met ` ℂ))
  cnxmet()
  mopnuni((abs ∘ -), cc, c0)
  cnfldtopn(c0)
  diff.hs1.c((hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0))))
  diff.hs1.c((ℂ \ ℝ))

  diff.hs1.c(crp)
  diff.hs1.w((hs0[(ball `(abs ∘ -))](abs `(Im ` hs0)))⊆(ℂ \ ℝ))

  diff.hs0.c((ℂ \ ℝ))
  diff.hs1.c((abs ∘ -))
  diff.hs1.c(cc)

  ralrimiva(hs1, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cz)), wrex(hs2, co(c0, crest, cz), wa(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), wss(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)))))

  3syl(wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cpw(cz)), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))), wcel(cin(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, ccom(cabs, cmin)), nat1), cz), co(c0, crest, cz)), wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wcel(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, ccom(cabs, cmin)), nat1), c0))
  mp3an13(wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wcel(co(cv(hs1), cfv(cbl, ccom(cabs, cmin)), nat1), c0), wcel(ccom(cabs, cmin), cfv(cxmet, cc)), wcel(nat1, cxr))
  blopn(ccom(cabs, cmin), cc, cv(hs1), nat1, c0)

blocks.name: sszcld
blocks.content: Every subset of the integers are closed in the topology on ` CC ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jul-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm sszcld(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wss(c0, cz), wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
} = {
  sylancr(wss(c0, cz), wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(cz, cfv(ccld, c1)), wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, co(c1, crest, cz))))
  zcld2(c1)
  sylanblrc(wss(c0, cz), wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, co(c1, crest, cz))), wss(c0, cz), wcel(cdif(cz, c0), co(c1, crest, cz)))
  id(wss(c0, cz))
  eleqtrri(cdif(cz, c0), co(c1, crest, cz), cpw(cz))
  elpwi2(cdif(cz, c0), cz, universe)
  zex()
  difss(cz, c0)
  zdis(c1)
  ax-mp(wb(wcel(c0, cfv(ccld, co(c1, crest, cz))), wa(wss(c0, cz), wcel(cdif(cz, c0), co(c1, crest, cz)))), wcel(co(c1, crest, cz), ctop))
  topontopi(co(c1, crest, cz), cz)
  iscld(co(c1, crest, cz), c0, cz)
  toponunii(cz, co(c1, crest, cz))
  mp2an(wcel(co(c1, crest, cz), cfv(ctopon, cz)), wcel(c1, cfv(ctopon, cc)), wss(cz, cc))
  cnfldtopon(c1)
  zsscn()
  resttopon(c1, cc, cz)
  restcldr(cz, c1, c0)
}

thm sszcld(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ⊆ ℤ → c0 ∈(Clsd ` c1))
  ⊣ c1 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)
} = {
  sylancr(c0 ⊆ ℤ, c0 ∈(Clsd ` c1), ℤ ∈(Clsd ` c1), c0 ∈(Clsd `(c1[|`t]ℤ)))
  zcld2(c1)
  sylanblrc(c0 ⊆ ℤ, c0 ∈(Clsd `(c1[|`t]ℤ)), c0 ⊆ ℤ, (ℤ \ c0)∈(c1[|`t]ℤ))
  id(c0 ⊆ ℤ)
  eleqtrri((ℤ \ c0), (c1[|`t]ℤ), P(ℤ))
  elpwi2((ℤ \ c0), cz, universe)
  zex()
  difss(cz, c0)
  zdis(c1)
  ax-mp((c0 ∈(Clsd `(c1[|`t]ℤ))↔(c0 ⊆ ℤ ∧(ℤ \ c0)∈(c1[|`t]ℤ))), (c1[|`t]ℤ)∈ Top)
  topontopi((c1[|`t]ℤ), cz)
  iscld((c1[|`t]ℤ), c0, cz)
  toponunii(cz, (c1[|`t]ℤ))
  mp2an((c1[|`t]ℤ)∈(TopOn ` ℤ), c1 ∈(TopOn ` ℂ), ℤ ⊆ ℂ)
  cnfldtopon(c1)
  zsscn()
  resttopon(c1, cc, cz)
  restcldr(cz, c1, c0)
}

blocks.name: reperflem
blocks.content: A subset of the real numbers that is closed under addition with real numbers is perfect. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm reperflem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {

blocks.name: reperf
blocks.content: The real numbers are a perfect subset of the complex numbers. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2016.)

blocks.name: cnperf
blocks.content: The complex numbers are a perfect space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Dec-2016.)
blocks.origin:
thm cnperf(class c0) {
  |- wcel(c0, cperf)
  -| wceq(c0, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
} = {
  eqeltrri(c0, cperf, co(c0, crest, cc))
  ax-mp(wceq(co(c0, crest, cc), c0), wcel(c0, cfv(ctopon, cc)))
  restid(c0, cfv(ctopon, cc), cc)
  toponunii(cc, c0)
  cnfldtopon(c0)
  reperflem(hs1, hs0, c0, cc)
  sylan2(wcel(cv(hs1), cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cr), wcel(co(cv(hs1), caddc, cv(hs0)), cc), wcel(cv(hs0), cc))
  recn(cv(hs0))
  addcl(cv(hs1), cv(hs0))
  ssid(cc)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm cnperf(class c0) {
  ⊢ c0 ∈ Perf
  ⊣ c0 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)
} = {
  eqeltrri(c0, cperf, (c0[|`t]ℂ))
  ax-mp((c0[|`t]ℂ)= c0, c0 ∈(TopOn ` ℂ))
  restid(c0, (TopOn ` ℂ), cc)
  toponunii(cc, c0)
  cnfldtopon(c0)
  reperflem(hs1, hs0, c0, cc)
  sylan2(hs1 ∈ ℂ, hs0 ∈ ℝ, (hs1[+]hs0)∈ ℂ, hs0 ∈ ℂ)
  recn(hs0)
  addcl(hs1, hs0)
  ssid(cc)
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(cc)
  diff.hs0.c(cc)
}

thm icccmplem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2))))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c3, crest, co(c0, cicc, c2)))
  -| wceq(c5, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr)))
  -| wceq(c1, crab(s1, co(c0, cicc, c2), wrex(s2, cin(cpw(c6), cfn), wss(co(c0, cicc, cv(s1)), cuni(cv(s2))))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c0, cle, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c6, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wss(co(c0, cicc, c2), cuni(c6)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c2)
  -| diffsc(s2, c3)
  -| diffsc(s2, c4)
  -| diffsc(s2, c6)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), wceq(c3, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), wceq(c4, co(c3, crest, co(c0, cicc, c2))))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), wceq(c5, cres(ccom(cabs, cmin), cxp(cr, cr))))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), wi(w0, wss(c6, c3)))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), diffss(s0, s2))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), diffsc(s0, c0))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), diffsc(s0, c1))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), diffsc(s0, c2))
  a1ii(wi(w0, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wral(s0, c1, wbr(cv(s0), cle, c2)))), diffsc(s0, c6))

blocks.name: reconnlem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ reconn . (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 17-Aug-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 9-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm reconnlem2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wn(wss(c0, cun(c1, c2))))
  -| wi(w0, wss(c0, cr))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo))))
  -| wi(w0, wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c0, wss(co(cv(s0), cicc, cv(s1)), c0))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, cin(c1, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, cin(c2, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wss(cin(c1, c2), cdif(cr, c0)))
  -| wi(w0, wbr(c3, cle, c4))
  -| wceq(c5, csup(cin(c1, co(c3, cicc, c4)), cr, clt))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  mtod(w0, wss(c0, cun(c1, c2)), wcel(c5, cun(c1, c2)))

blocks.name: retopconn
blocks.content: Corollary of ~ reconn . The set of real numbers is connected. (Contributed by Jeff Hankins, 17-Aug-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm retopconn() {
  |- wcel(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), cconn)
} = {

  retop()
  restid(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), ctop, cr)
  uniretop()
  mpbir(wcel(co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, cr), cconn), wral(hs0, cr, wral(hs1, cr, wss(co(cv(hs0), cicc, cv(hs1)), cr))))
  rgen2a(hs0, hs1, cr, wss(co(cv(hs0), cicc, cv(hs1)), cr))
  iccssre(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  ax-mp(wb(wcel(co(cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)), crest, cr), cconn), wral(hs0, cr, wral(hs1, cr, wss(co(cv(hs0), cicc, cv(hs1)), cr)))), wss(cr, cr))
  ssid(cr)
  reconn(hs0, hs1, cr)
  diff.hs1.c(cr)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(cr)
}

blocks.name: iccconn

blocks.name: xrge0tsms
blocks.content: Any finite or infinite sum in the nonnegative extended reals is uniquely convergent to the supremum of all finite sums. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 26-Jul-2019.)

blocks.name: xrge0tsms2
blocks.content: Any finite or infinite sum in the nonnegative extended reals is convergent. This is a rather unique property of the set ` [ 0 , +oo ] ` ; a similar theorem is not true for ` RR* ` or ` RR ` or ` [ 0 , +oo ) ` . It is true for ` NN0 u. { +oo } ` , however, or more generally any additive submonoid of ` [ 0 , +oo ) ` with ` +oo ` adjoined. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm xrge0tsms2(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c2, c0, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf))), wbr(co(c3, ctsu, c2), cen, c1o))
  -| wceq(c3, co(cxrs, cress, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)))
} = {
  syl6eqbr(co(c3, ctsu, c2), cen, c1o, csn(csup(crn(cmpt(hs0, cin(cpw(c0), cfn), co(c3, cgsu, cres(c2, cv(hs0))))), cxr, clt)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf(c2, c0, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf))))

blocks.name: xmetdcn2
blocks.content: The metric function of an extended metric space is always continuous in the topology generated by it. In this variation of ~ xmetdcn we use the metric topology instead of the order topology on ` RR* ` , which makes the theorem a bit stronger. Since ` +oo ` is an isolated point in the metric topology, this is saying that for any points ` A , B ` which are an infinite distance apart, there is a product neighborhood around ` <. A , B >. ` such that ` d ( a , b ) = +oo ` for any ` a ` near ` A ` and ` b ` near ` B ` , i.e. the distance function is locally constant ` +oo ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: xmetdcn
blocks.content: The metric function of an extended metric space is always continuous in the topology generated by it. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.)

thm xmetdcn(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)), wcel(c0, co(co(c2, ctx, c2), ccn, c3)))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cmopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cordt, cle))
} = {
  sseldi(c0, co(co(c2, ctx, c2), ccn, c3), co(co(c2, ctx, c2), ccn, cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs))), wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)))
  mp2an(wss(co(co(c2, ctx, c2), ccn, cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs))), co(co(c2, ctx, c2), ccn, c3)), wcel(c3, cfv(ctopon, cxr)), wss(c3, cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs))))
  eqeltri(c3, cfv(ctopon, cxr), cfv(cordt, cle))
  letopon()
  eqsstri(c3, cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs)), cfv(cordt, cle))
  xrsmopn(cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs)), cfv(cds, cxrs))
  cnss2(c3, cxr, cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs)), co(c2, ctx, c2))
  ax-mp(wceq(cxr, cuni(cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs)))), wcel(cfv(cds, cxrs), cfv(cxmet, cxr)))
  xrsxmet(cfv(cds, cxrs))
  mopnuni(cfv(cds, cxrs), cxr, cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs)))
  xmetdcn2(c0, c1, c2, cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs)), cfv(cds, cxrs))
  eqid(cfv(cds, cxrs))
  eqid(cfv(cmopn, cfv(cds, cxrs)))
}

  ⊢ (c0 ∈(*Met ` c1)→ c0 ∈((c2[tX]c2)[Cn]c3))
  ⊣ c2 =(MetOpen ` c0)
  ⊣ c3 =(ordTop ` ≤)

  xrsmopn((MetOpen `(dist ` ℝ*)), (dist ` ℝ*))

  syl(wcel(c0, cms), wcel(cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2)), co(co(cfv(cmopn, cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2))), ctx, cfv(cmopn, cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2)))), ccn, c4)), wcel(cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2)), cfv(cmet, c2)))

  oveq1d(co(c3, ctx, c3), ccn, c4, co(cfv(cmopn, cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2))), ctx, cfv(cmopn, cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2)))), wcel(c0, cms))
  oveq12d(c3, ctx, c3, cfv(cmopn, cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2))), cfv(cmopn, cres(c1, cxp(c2, c2))), wcel(c0, cms))

blocks.content: The norm of a normed group is a continuous function. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2015.)

thm nmcn(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cngp), wcel(c1, co(c2, ccn, c3)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cnm, c0))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(ctopn, c0))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(ctg, crn(cioo)))
} = {
  syl5eqel(c1, co(c2, ccn, c3), cmpt(hs0, cfv(cbs, c0), co(cv(hs0), cfv(cds, c0), cfv(c0g, c0))), wcel(c0, cngp))
  nmfval(hs0, c1, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cds, c0), cfv(c0g, c0), c0)
  cnmpt1ds(hs0, cfv(cbs, c0), cv(hs0), cfv(cds, c0), cfv(c0g, c0), c2, c3, c0, c2, wcel(c0, cngp))
  eqid(cfv(cds, c0))
  ngpms(c0)
  cnmptid(hs0, cfv(cbs, c0), c2, wcel(c0, cngp))
  cnmptc(hs0, cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(c0g, c0), c2, c2, cfv(cbs, c0), wcel(c0, cngp))
  sylib(wcel(c0, cngp), wcel(c2, cfv(ctopon, cfv(cbs, c0))), wcel(c0, ctps))
  ngptps(c0)
  istps(c0, c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, cngp), wcel(cfv(c0g, c0), cfv(cbs, c0)), wcel(c0, cgrp))
  ngpgrp(c0)
  grpidcl(c0, cfv(c0g, c0), cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c0))
  eqid(cfv(c0g, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cbs, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(cds, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(cfv(c0g, c0))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)

  a1ii(wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(cfv(c2, c0), cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c3, co(c0, c4, cv(s0)))), cxr, clt))), diffsc(s0, c4))
  fvmpt(s1, c0, c1, c2, cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c3, co(c0, c4, cv(s0)))), cxr, clt), cinf(crn(cmpt(s0, c3, co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)))), cxr, clt))
  infeq1d(crn(cmpt(s0, c3, co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0)))), cxr, clt, crn(cmpt(s0, c3, co(c0, c4, cv(s0)))), wceq(cv(s1), c0))
  rneqd(cmpt(s0, c3, co(cv(s1), c4, cv(s0))), cmpt(s0, c3, co(c0, c4, cv(s0))), wceq(cv(s1), c0))

blocks.name: metdsge
blocks.content: The distance from the point ` A ` to the set ` S ` is greater than ` R ` iff the ` R ` -ball around ` A ` misses ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Sep-2020.)

blocks.name: metdstri
blocks.content: A generalization of the triangle inequality to the point-set distance function. Under the usual notation where the same symbol ` d ` denotes the point-point and point-set distance functions, this theorem would be written ` d ( a , S ) <_ d ( a , b ) + d ( b , S ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Sep-2015.)

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)

blocks.name: metdsle
blocks.content: The distance from a point to a set is bounded by the distance to any member of the set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Sep-2015.)

thm metdsle(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {

blocks.name: metdsre

  ffnd(c3, c1, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf), wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)))
  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wf(c3, c1, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)))
  ralrimiva(hs1, c1, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2)), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cr))
  anassrs(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cr))
  syl22anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cr), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cxr), wcel(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1)), cr), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(c3, cv(hs1))), wbr(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cle, co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1))))
  syl(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), cxr), wcel(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)))
  eliccxr(cfv(c3, cv(hs1)), nat0, cpnf)
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))), wcel(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1)), cr), wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(cv(hs1), c1))
  simpll(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)))
  adantrr(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c1))
  sselda(cv(hs0), c2, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)))

  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, cfv(cmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1)), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c2), wcel(cv(hs1), c1)), wf(c3, c1, co(nat0, cicc, cpnf)))

  diff.hs1.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs1)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs1)
  diff.hs1.s(s1)

blocks.pretty:
thm metdsre(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1 ∧ c2 ≠ ∅)→(c3 : c1 → ℝ))
  ⊣ c3 =(s0 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((s1 ∈ c2 ↦(s0[c0]s1))), ℝ*, <))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
} = {
  3impia(c0 ∈(Met ` c1), c2 ⊆ c1, c2 ≠ ∅, (c3 : c1 → ℝ))
  syl5bi((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1), c2 ≠ ∅, (c3 : c1 → ℝ), ∃(hs0, hs0 ∈ c2))
  n0(hs0, c2)
  exlimdv(hs0, (c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1), hs0 ∈ c2, (c3 : c1 → ℝ))

  ffnd(c3, c1, (0[[,]]+∞), ((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1)∧ hs0 ∈ c2))
  adantr((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1), hs0 ∈ c2, (c3 : c1 →(0[[,]]+∞)))
  ralrimiva(hs1, c1, ((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1)∧ hs0 ∈ c2), (c3 ` hs1)∈ ℝ)
  anassrs((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1), hs0 ∈ c2, hs1 ∈ c1, (c3 ` hs1)∈ ℝ)
  syl22anc(((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1)∧(hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1)), (c3 ` hs1)∈ ℝ, (c3 ` hs1)∈ ℝ*, (hs0[c0]hs1)∈ ℝ, 0[≤](c3 ` hs1), (c3 ` hs1)[≤](hs0[c0]hs1))
  syl(((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1)∧(hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1)), (c3 ` hs1)∈ ℝ*, (c3 ` hs1)∈(0[[,]]+∞))
  eliccxr((c3 ` hs1), nat0, cpnf)
  syl3anc(((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1)∧(hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1)), (hs0[c0]hs1)∈ ℝ, c0 ∈(Met ` c1), hs0 ∈ c1, hs1 ∈ c1)
  simpll(c0 ∈(Met ` c1), c2 ⊆ c1, (hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1))
  adantrr((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1), hs0 ∈ c2, hs1 ∈ c1, hs0 ∈ c1)
  sselda(hs0, c2, c1, (c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1))
  simpr(c0 ∈(Met ` c1), c2 ⊆ c1)
  metcl(c0, c1, hs0, hs1)
  syl(((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1)∧(hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1)), 0[≤](c3 ` hs1), (c3 ` hs1)∈(0[[,]]+∞))
  ffvelrnd(c3, hs1, (0[[,]]+∞), c1, ((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1)∧(hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1)))
  adantr((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1), (hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c1), (c3 : c1 →(0[[,]]+∞)))
  sylan(c0 ∈(Met ` c1), c2 ⊆ c1, (c3 : c1 →(0[[,]]+∞)), c0 ∈(*Met ` c1))
  metdsf(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  simprr((c0 ∈(Met ` c1)∧ c2 ⊆ c1), hs0 ∈ c2, hs1 ∈ c1)

}

blocks.name: metdseq0

thm metdseq0(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfv(cxmet, c1)), wss(c2, c1), wcel(c3, c1)), wb(wceq(cfv(c4, c3), nat0), wcel(c3, cfv(cfv(ccl, c5), c2))))

thm metnrm(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈(*Met ` c1)→ c2 ∈ Nrm)
  ⊣ c2 =(MetOpen ` c0)
} = {
  sylanbrc(c0 ∈(*Met ` c1), c2 ∈ Nrm, c2 ∈ Top, ∀(hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c2), ∀(hs1 ∈(Clsd ` c2),((hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅ → ∃(hs2 ∈ c2, ∃(hs3 ∈ c2,(hs0 ⊆ hs2 ∧ hs1 ⊆ hs3 ∧(hs2 ⋂ hs3)= ∅)))))))
  mopntop(c0, c1, c2)
  ralrimivva(hs0, hs1, (Clsd ` c2), (Clsd ` c2), c0 ∈(*Met ` c1), ((hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅ → ∃(hs2 ∈ c2, ∃(hs3 ∈ c2,(hs0 ⊆ hs2 ∧ hs1 ⊆ hs3 ∧(hs2 ⋂ hs3)= ∅)))))
  3expia(c0 ∈(*Met ` c1), (hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c2)∧ hs1 ∈(Clsd ` c2)), (hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅, ∃(hs2 ∈ c2, ∃(hs3 ∈ c2,(hs0 ⊆ hs2 ∧ hs1 ⊆ hs3 ∧(hs2 ⋂ hs3)= ∅))))
  metnrmlem3(hs2, hs3, hs4, hs5, hs6, hs7, c2, hs0, hs1, (hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs0 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <)), c1, c0, ⋃(hs6 ∈ hs1,(hs6[(ball ` c0)](if(1[≤]((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs0 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs6), 1,((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs0 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs6))[÷]2))), (hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs1 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <)), ⋃(hs7 ∈ hs0,(hs7[(ball ` c0)](if(1[≤]((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs1 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs7), 1,((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs1 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs7))[÷]2))), (c0 ∈(*Met ` c1)∧(hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c2)∧ hs1 ∈(Clsd ` c2))∧(hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅))
  eqid((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs0 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <)))
  simp1(c0 ∈(*Met ` c1), (hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c2)∧ hs1 ∈(Clsd ` c2)), (hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅)
  simp2l(c0 ∈(*Met ` c1), hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c2), hs1 ∈(Clsd ` c2), (hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅)
  simp2r(c0 ∈(*Met ` c1), hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c2), hs1 ∈(Clsd ` c2), (hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅)
  simp3(c0 ∈(*Met ` c1), (hs0 ∈(Clsd ` c2)∧ hs1 ∈(Clsd ` c2)), (hs0 ⋂ hs1)= ∅)
  eqid(⋃(hs6 ∈ hs1,(hs6[(ball ` c0)](if(1[≤]((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs0 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs6), 1,((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs0 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs6))[÷]2))))
  eqid((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs1 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <)))
  eqid(⋃(hs7 ∈ hs0,(hs7[(ball ` c0)](if(1[≤]((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs1 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs7), 1,((hs4 ∈ c1 ↦ inf(ran((hs5 ∈ hs1 ↦(hs4[c0]hs5))), ℝ*, <))` hs7))[÷]2))))

thm addcnlem(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, class c0, class c1) {

  -| wf(c0, cxp(cc, cc), cc)

blocks.name: cnfldtgp
blocks.content: The complex numbers form a topological group under addition, with the standard topology induced by the absolute value metric. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: fsumcn
blocks.content: A finite sum of functions to complex numbers from a common topological space is continuous. The class expression for ` B ` normally contains free variables ` k ` and ` x ` to index it. (Contributed by NM, 8-Aug-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Aug-2014.)

thm fsumcn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ c1, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4))
  ⊣ c4 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈(TopOn ` c0))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ Fin)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s1 ∈ c1)→(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c2)∈(c3[Cn]c4))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpi(w0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ c1, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4), c1 ⊆ c1)
  ssid(c1)
  mpcom(w0, (c1 ⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ c1, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4)), c1 ∈ Fin)
  findcard2s(hs0, hs1, hs2, c1, (w0 →(c1 ⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ c1, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4))), (w0 →(hs0 ⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ hs0, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4))), (w0 →(∅ ⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ ∅, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4))), (w0 →(hs1 ⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ hs1, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4))), (w0 →((hs1 ⋃ { hs2 })⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }), c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4))))
  imbi2d(hs0 = ∅, w0, (hs0 ⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ hs0, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4)), (∅ ⊆ c1 →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ ∅, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4)))
  imbi12d(hs0 = ∅, hs0 ⊆ c1, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ hs0, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4), ∅ ⊆ c1, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ ∅, c2))∈(c3[Cn]c4))
  sseq1(hs0, emptycls, c1)
  eleq1d((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ hs0, c2)), (c3[Cn]c4), (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ sum(s1 ∈ ∅, c2)), hs0 = ∅)
  mpteq2dv(s0, c0, sum(s1 ∈ hs0, c2), sum(s1 ∈ ∅, c2), hs0 = ∅)
  sumeq1(s1, hs0, emptycls, c2)

  ⊢ (w0 →(s0 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ c1 ↦ sum(s2 ∈ c2, c3))∈((c4[tX]c5)[Cn]c6))
  ⊣ c6 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 ∈(TopOn ` c0))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ Fin)
  ⊣ (w0 → c5 ∈(TopOn ` c1))
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s2 ∈ c2)→(s0 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ c1 ↦ c3)∈((c4[tX]c5)[Cn]c6))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)

  ⊣ d(s2, c6)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s1, w0)
  ⊣ d(s2, w0)
} = {
  a1ii((w0 →(s0 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ c1 ↦ sum(s2 ∈ c2, c3))∈((c4[tX]c5)[Cn]c6)), d(s0, c4))

  eqtr4i((s0 ∈ c0, s1 ∈ c1 ↦ sum(s2 ∈ c2, c3)), (hs0 ∈(c0 × c1)↦ sum(s2 ∈ c2,[(2nd ` hs0)/ s1][(1st ` hs0)/ s0]c3)), (hs1 ∈ c0, hs2 ∈ c1 ↦ sum(s2 ∈ c2,[hs2 / s1][hs1 / s0]c3)))

  mpt2mpt(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1, sum(s2 ∈ c2,[(2nd ` hs0)/ s1][(1st ` hs0)/ s0]c3), sum(s2 ∈ c2,[hs2 / s1][hs1 / s0]c3))
  sumeq2sdv(s2, c2, [(2nd ` hs0)/ s1][(1st ` hs0)/ s0]c3, [hs2 / s1][hs1 / s0]c3, hs0 = < hs1, hs2 >)

  eqtrd([(2nd ` hs0)/ s1][(1st ` hs0)/ s0]c3, [hs2 / s1][hs1 / s0]c3, [hs2 / s1][(1st ` hs0)/ s0]c3, hs0 = < hs1, hs2 >)

blocks.name: expcn
blocks.content: The power function on complex numbers, for fixed exponent ` N ` , is continuous. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Aug-2014.)

thm expcn(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cn0), wcel(cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cexp, c0)), co(c1, ccn, c1)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {

blocks.content: Division by a nonzero constant is a continuous operation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2014.)

thm divccn(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0)), co(c1, ccn, c1)))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(ctopn, ccnfld))

} = {
  eqeltrd(cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0)), co(c1, ccn, c1), cmpt(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, c0))), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  mpteq2dva(s0, cc, co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0), co(cv(s0), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, c0)), wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  ancoms(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cv(s0), cc), wceq(co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0), co(cv(s0), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, c0))))
  3expb(wcel(cv(s0), cc), wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0), wceq(co(cv(s0), cdiv, c0), co(cv(s0), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, c0))))
  divrec(cv(s0), c0)
  cnmpt12f(s0, cc, cv(s0), cmul, co(nat1, cdiv, c0), c1, c1, c1, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  cnmptid(s0, cc, c1, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  cnmptc(s0, cc, co(nat1, cdiv, c0), c1, c1, cc, wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cfv(ctopon, cc)))
  cnfldtopon(c1)
  reccl(c0)
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(cmul, co(co(c1, ctx, c1), ccn, c1)))
  mulcn(c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, cc), wne(c0, nat0))

  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0)→(s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(s0[÷]c0))∈(c1[Cn]c1))
  ⊣ c1 =(TopOpen ` CCfld)

} = {
  eqeltrd((s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(s0[÷]c0)), (c1[Cn]c1), (s0 ∈ ℂ ↦(s0[×](1[÷]c0))), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  mpteq2dva(s0, cc, (s0[÷]c0), (s0[×](1[÷]c0)), (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  ancoms((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), s0 ∈ ℂ, (s0[÷]c0)=(s0[×](1[÷]c0)))
  3expb(s0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0, (s0[÷]c0)=(s0[×](1[÷]c0)))
  divrec(s0, c0)
  cnmpt12f(s0, cc, s0, cmul, (1[÷]c0), c1, c1, c1, c1, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))
  cnmptid(s0, cc, c1, (c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0))

  a1i((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), c1 ∈(TopOn ` ℂ))
  cnfldtopon(c1)
  reccl(c0)
  a1i((c0 ∈ ℂ ∧ c0 ≠ 0), × ∈((c1[tX]c1)[Cn]c1))
  mulcn(c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c0 ∈ ℂ, c0 ≠ 0)

blocks.name: sqcn
blocks.content: The square function on complex numbers is continuous. (Contributed by NM, 13-Jun-2007.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2014.)
